sense.name: Praise, glorify, or honor, possibly as a matter of overstatement.
sense.commentary: Syntax Includes: NP1[agent] GLORIFY NP2[patient] NP1[theme] GLORIFY NP2[patient]
sense.examples: It's easy to glorify one's spouse's cooking when in love. The concept of nationalism glorifies the territorial state. The victory over the enemy glorified the Republic. You're glorifying a rather mediocre building.

sense.name: Elevate or idealize, in allusion to Christ's transfiguration.
sense.commentary: Syntax Is: NP1 GLORIFY NP2 Note: NP2 is reflexive.
sense.examples: We glorify ourselves with our submission. He glorified himself through his humility.
